title: Class 9 History MCQ Test: Socialism in Europe and the Russian Revolution (Score out of 50)

requirements.text: Create an MCQ test experience for Class 9 History chapter “Socialism in Europe and the Russian Revolution” focused on the topics: (1) The First World War and the Russian Empire, (2) The February Revolution and Petrograd, and (3) After February.

quotes: proper MCQ test of the chapter socialism in Europe and the Russian revolution chapter of history especially the topics like , the first world war and thee Russian empire, the February Revolution and Petrograd, after february class 9th

acceptanceCriteria: The app provides an MCQ test screen with questions from the specified chapter and topic areas.
Each question shows a prompt and multiple answer options (single correct answer).

requirements.text: Implement a full test flow where the user answers MCQs and receives a final score out of 50 when the test ends.

quotes: there will be questions and I will give answer as a proper MCQ test and at the end it will give me my score out of 50

acceptanceCriteria: The user can progress through the test by selecting exactly one option per question and moving forward.
At the end of the test, the UI displays “Score: X / 50” where X is computed from the user’s answers.
The score computation is deterministic and based on the stored correct answers.

requirements.text: Provide a question set that progresses from easy to hard difficulty across the test (earlier questions easier, later questions harder).

quotes: it should have easy to hard questions

acceptanceCriteria: Questions are tagged or organized by difficulty (at least: easy, medium, hard).
The delivered test order shows a clear difficulty progression from easy to hard.

requirements.text: Backend: store and serve the MCQ question bank (including topic, difficulty, options, and correct answer) from the single Motoko actor, and provide a scoring mechanism that returns the final score out of 50 based on submitted answers.
acceptanceCriteria: A backend method returns the full test’s questions needed to take the quiz (without exposing correct answers to the client in that payload).
A backend method accepts the user’s selected answers and returns the computed score out of 50.
The backend question set includes coverage for the three requested topic areas.

requirements.text: Frontend: build a clean test-taking UI with (1) a start screen describing the chapter/topics and total score out of 50, (2) a question screen with answer selection and navigation, and (3) an end screen showing the final score out of 50 and an option to restart the test.
acceptanceCriteria: The start screen clearly indicates the test is for Class 9 History and shows that the final score is out of 50.
The question screen allows selecting one option per question and prevents accidental submission without a selection (by disabling next/submit until selected, or equivalent).
The end screen shows the final score out of 50 and includes a restart action that resets progress.

requirements.text: Add a coherent, distinctive visual theme for the quiz site (colors, typography, layout) and apply it consistently across all screens; do not use a blue/purple primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages/screens share a consistent design system (buttons, cards, headings, spacing).
The primary palette is not blue/purple.

requirements.text: Add the generated static image asset(s) to the frontend and render them in the UI (served from frontend/public/assets/generated).
acceptanceCriteria: The generated image(s) exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
At least one app screen displays the generated image(s) (e.g., start screen header/banner).

constraints: Use English for all user-facing UI text.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all Motoko logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose them instead.
nonGoals: User accounts, Internet Identity login, or saving historical attempts across sessions.
Admin UI for creating/editing questions in the browser.

required: Vintage textbook-style banner illustration with subtle Russian revolution motifs (no text), warm paper background, pen-and-ink look (history-quiz-banner.dim_1600x400.png)
